title: Echigo-Tsumari Art Triennial
text: The Echigo-Tsumari Art Triennial is an international <a href="modern%20art">modern art</a> festival held once every three years in the <a href="Niigata%20prefecture">Niigata prefecture</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. The festival was created by the Tokyo commercial gallery Art Front Gallery (AFG) and is directed by Fram Kitagawa. It was first held in 2000 for a "grand" two-month exhibition in "communities, rice fields, vacant houses, and closed schools across a 760 square kilometer (187,800 acre) region." In 2009 the pieces included a silver "croquette" house serving a <a href="croquette">croquette</a> of locally harvested potatoes, a herb shop, a giant <a href="grasshopper">grasshopper</a> slide, and a sculpture of a giant man.
